topic_rationale: Choosing 'Legionella pneumonia' as it is a common cause of severe community-acquired pneumonia (CAP) that can be overlooked due to its unique transmission and diagnostic modalities. It is an educational opportunity to highlight key features of this disease.

explanations.tile_0: Legionella is often associated with outbreaks in buildings with complex water systems like hotels.
explanations.tile_1: Hyponatremia is a common electrolyte disturbance in Legionella due to SIADH.
explanations.tile_2: Productive cough is a common symptom of Legionella pneumonia.
explanations.tile_3: High fever is a typical feature of Legionella.
explanations.tile_4: Abnormal liver function tests can be seen in Legionella infection.
explanations.tile_5: Legionella is resistant to β-lactam antibiotics due to the absence of peptidoglycan in its cell wall.
explanations.tile_6: Gastrointestinal symptoms like diarrhea are common in Legionella infection.
explanations.tile_7: Chest X-ray in Legionella pneumonia often shows patchy infiltrates.
explanations.tile_8: Urine antigen test is a quick and specific diagnostic test for Legionella.
